item.title: Calculate pi by throwing needles
item.description: Suppose that you drop a short needle on ruled paper, what is then the probability that the needle comes to lie in a position where it crosses one of the lines? - Georges Buffon, 1777 When the needle is the right length, the answer is pi! Here is a quick example in R of approximating the value of Pi by tossing digital needles onto lined paper. library(retistruct) Make a needle
